At 20:27 21/09/2004 +0100, you wrote:
>Ian Badcoe wrote:
> >I would not say it was true that TWEANs are a subset of GP, I would say
> >that TWEANs are analogous to a subset of GP.
> >
> >
>Ok so I wasn't that far off the mark. As discussed on the list recently,
>one possible direction I will be taking SharpNEAT is to introduce a few
>more possible activation functions - multiplication being one. So I
>really think this blurs the lines between GP and TWEANs somewhat.

I think that's a good way to go, just blurring the line a very little 
because NEAT works _much_ better than the average GP...

(Just to inspire you and not as any sort of demand :) wish list of 
activation functions:

Sum
Sigmoid
Multiply
Difference (higher output the more variety in the inputs)
Similarity (1/difference)
Mode (copies the middle input)
Max
Min
Sum of squares
Step

(and all of these might come in 0 to 1 and -1 to +1 varieties, or is that a 
red-herring?)

Also, how about types of connection, e.g:

Simple Weight
Weight and Clamp to Max
Weight and Clamp to Min
Abs
Weight and square

Not that I'm trying to make it insanely complex :)

         Ian
